intro: Hasskarlia didymostemon, commonly known as the double-stemmed hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically measure 10–15 cm in diameter. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in swampy or marshy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant.
